bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 45 (Monday, March 9, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BROWN of Maryland:H.R. 6146.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Art. 1, Sec. 8, Cl. 14[Page H1556]

item.name: Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee

item.title: William M. (Mac) Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021

latestAction.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation.

item.name: Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation Subcommittee

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

Referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, and in addition to the Committee on Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

Referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, and in addition to the Committee on Armed Services, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned.

summary.text:
Oversight and Verification of Expenses and Readiness for Security Engagements Abroad Act of 2020 or the OVERSEA Act of 2020

This bill directs the Government Accountability Office to report on the U.S. Coast Guard's allocation of resources to support its defense readiness mission, including an assessment of the impacts on the Coast Guard's nondefense mission readiness and operational capabilities due to the annual levels of funding provided by the Department of Defense to compensate the Coast Guard for its expenses to fulfill its defense readiness mission.

bill.title: OVERSEA Act of 2020

item.title: To direct the Comptroller General of the United States to report on Coast Guard defense readiness resource allocation, and for other purposes.
Oversight and Verification of Expenses and Readiness for Security Engagements Abroad Act of 2020

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Coast Guard and Maritime Transportation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
